channel.title: Docker on Eric's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Docker on Eric's Blog

item.title: UNRAID - Restricting Docker External Access for Self-Hosted Containers and Access via Reverse Proxy
item.description: Note: This doesn’t apply to only UNRAID, as it is just Docker configurations but I include steps for UNRAID. I won’t be going into creating a reverse proxy (There are plenty of tutorials out there for that but I recommend NGINX Proxy Manager if you are new) If you self-host a lot of applications you may find that sometimes you worry about what happens if it is compromised. Maybe it’s an application that holds sensitive information such as a password manager you don’t want exposed except in your network (via VPN).
